content.description: Operation Epsom is a super fun face climb on the right side of the Band Of Brothers Alcove. Start matched on a good rail, and make a few thin moves to a jug crimp by the corner. Make one or two more committing moves to top out over the slab. Good rock, good movement, and good landing make this a fun warm-up on the fingers.
content.location: This is on the right side of BOB Alcove and is pretty obvious to find. It starts on a high rail a few feet right of a jenky flake in the ground.

content.description: Band Of Brothers is the best line at the alcove. It climbs out the center of the impressive overhang following a nice black streak. Start on the ledge, and climb up taking care of the choss, then stand out of the ledge to grab 2 crimps in the overhang. Work straight up with a committing crux move to a good meathook at the lip. Top out onto the slab via good holds. Very good movement, a flat landing, and enough height to be spicy makes this climb an absolute classic.
content.location: On the main overhang at the alcove, start in the choss, and head up the depression following a black streak and cool holds. The slab is on for everything, though itâ€™s not very useful.
